ja16:1.1: This time, the deer attentively learns the ruses of deer and escapes the hunter by playing dead. | Each attribute of the deer is described numerically.
ja16:1.2: Here _aṭṭha_ chimes with _aḍḍha_. Perhaps the sense is that the cloven hooves make little sound.
ja16:1.4: Several sets of six tricks are enumerated in the commentary. | Here _kalā_ means “trick, deceit”. | _Chahi kalāhi_ here chimes with _sattahi kālāti_ in the previous verse. Though they are in different metres, they must have been composed together.
